Description: Lower body and conical foot sherd of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style patterned, pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black with reserved dot in centre of bowl; exterior: reserved on bowl and at junction of bowl and foot; glazed streaky black on foot; underside: trace of white slip; inscription on underside.
Curator's comments: For parallels regarding squat patterned chalices, see Lemos no. 1062 from Kamiros. The number 771 is written in pencil on the underside of the foot.
Bibliographic references: Johnston 2006a / Trademarks on Greek Vases: Addenda (p. 171, no. 60)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1134) (phase 2)
